title: Finite field
summary: In mathematics, a finite field or Galois field (so-named in honor of Ã‰variste Galois) is a field that contains a finite number of elements.  As with any field, a finite field is a set on which the operations of multiplication, addition, subtraction and division are defined and satisfy certain basic rules.  The most common examples of finite fields are given by the integers mod p when p is a prime number.
